alert.note: Alert for East Cameron; Lower Vermilion; Northern Acadia; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Acadia; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; Upper Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 9:34PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cameron, Jefferson Davis, western Acadia, southeastern Calcasieu and northwestern Vermilion Parishes through 1015 PM CDT... At 934 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Thornwell, or near Lake Arthur, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jennings, Welsh, Iowa, Lake Arthur, Mermentau, Fenton, Lacassine National Wildlife Refuge, Hayes, Klondike, Evangeline, Pine Island, Thornwell, Lowry, Gibbstown, Hacketts Corner, Bell City, Roanoke, Lacassine and Hathaway. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 43 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Cameron; Lower Vermilion; Northern Acadia; Northern Jefferson Davis; Southern Acadia; Southern Calcasieu; Southern Jefferson Davis; Upper Vermilion
